data.title: Are you coming to Groningen by car, bus, train or plane?
data.meta_description: Are you coming to Groningen by car or public transport? There are plenty of car parks and connections throughout the province. Read more on visitgroningen.nl.
data.text:
In the city center you can park for a quick errand; maximum half an hour. Follow the P route if you want to use the underground car parks in the center. Of course you can stay there longer. You can also park your car a short distance from the center and continue your journey by bus. The P+R bus takes you to the city center and back. Parking is free and a P+R ticket only costs 6 euros (max. 5 people).

In the bus

Traveling with the OV chip card is usually the fastest and cheapest. On many routes you pay less with the OV chip card than with a bus ticket. You can now also purchase some tickets online via Q-buzz. This way you can easily order a Day ticket, P+R ticket or Dal-Day ticket. You then scan the barcode on the E-ticket on the bus. You can either print it out or scan it digitally. A single ticket on the bus can only be paid with a PIN/credit card, cash is no longer possible.

On the train

Traveling by train is also the cheapest and fastest with the OV chip card. A single ticket for your train journey is a one-time OV chip card. You can buy this at the ticket machine at the train station. Or you buy an e-ticket at NS. You can go to ticket machines to buy regional and national train tickets and to top up and pick up OV-chipkaart products.

You can rent bicycles at various places in Groningen. Public transport bicycles can be rented at Central Station, Groningen North Station and Groningen Europapark Station. You can also rent a bicycle at P+R Hoogkerk and P+R Kardinge. At many stations in the province it is possible to rent an OV-fiets. For other rentals you can go here:

Fiets & Service Groningen

Stationsweg 13

Tel: 06 53149416

Bikes in Groningen

Sint Jansstraat 25

+31 (0)6 24515546
